results.title: East side story : the story of Soviet musicals
results.brief_description: The Iron Curtain countries were not known for their joie de vivre, but between the cracks of stark socialist realism, there somehow appeared a few films that offered their audiences escape, hope and hit songs. With lots of colourful clips from singing pig farmers, dancing sailors, happy housewives, socialist summer vacations, the cinderella factory girl and of course the singing tractor-drivers, this moving, hilarious and courageous story is thoughtfully told by the filmmakers and actors themselves.

results.title: East African College
results.brief_description: A survey of the training being given to students at the British East African University College of Makerere. The story of a young female African student-teacher, is traced through her course, showing how every attempt is made to relate studies to the needs and background of the African people as a whole.

results.title: Earthworms
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of the earthworm and gives detailed information on its habits. Explains its value in digesting plant food to enrich the soil. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Earthquake
results.creator_credit: Film Associates and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Uses animation to demonstrate how an earthquake takes place. Shows the effects of earthquakes on landforms and on man-made structures. Explains how scientists learn more about earthquakes by studying the vibrations produced. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Earth = Zemlya
results.brief_description: The story is so slight as to be almost plotless; the young peasants of a Ukranian village want to buy a tractor to bring the future a little faster to their village but the kulaks of the community fear this strengthened unity and one of them kills the young village chairman. Yet this summary scarcely hints of all the qualities and passages that have made “Earth” one of the acknowledged classics of the Soviet and world cinema. The unique beauty of “Earth”, Dovzhenko’s best and last silent film, brought him international fame.

results.title: Earth = Zemlia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko, Black Hawk Films and VUFKU
results.brief_description: This classic Soviet film tells the story of a farming community in Iaresky in the Ukraine and of a landowner who refuses to hand over his land for a collective farm. However more importantly is the rustic beauty of this film in its telling of life, love and death. Cast: Simon Svashenko (Basil), Stephen Shukurat (Basil’s father), Peter Masokna (Thomas Whitehorse), Ellen Maximova (Basil’s fiancee). Note: Original Russian film soundtrack suffered of poor quality so was replaced by music score and English subtitles (added by Black Hawk Films) and the Russian dialogue removed.

results.title: Ears: their structure and care
results.brief_description: Illustrates the structure of the outer, middle and inner ear and describes the role of each in the hearing process. Discusses care of the ear and treatment of some common ailments relating to the ear. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Early days yet: a profile of the poet Allen Curnow
results.creator_credit: Shirley Horrocks and Point of View Productions
results.brief_description: This is a beautifully presented documentary about the life and memories of the highly acclaimed New Zealand poet, critic and anthropologist, Allen Curnow. At the age of almost 90, Allen Curnow still wrote poetry using “a ball-point, quantities of A4 paper, and a typewriter”. Charming, gentle and retiring, family man and serious poet, Allen Curnow has won many awards in the world of literature including seven New Zealand Book Awards and the first person outside of Britain to receive the Queen’s Gold Medal for Poetry. The program features Curnow reading several of his poems accompanied by evocative and emotive images to illustrate his writings which often reflect memories of people, places or events from his past. With his quiet sense of humor and reminiscing, and through interviews with his wife Jenny, and fellow poets including Bill Manhire, C.K. Stead, Ian Wedde, Leigh Davis and Elizabeth Smither, Allen Curnow allows us a glimpse into both his personal and his creative life. The documentary takes its title from his latest publication “Early days yet: new and collected poems 1941-1997”. Sadly Allen Curnow passed away on 23 September 2001, three months after completion of this film. Contains archival footage and some scenes in b&w.

results.title: Early Amateur Sound Film (1936–37)
results.brief_description: Amateur filmmaker Archie Stewart used an RCA Sound Camera to document family life from 1935. A member of the Amateur Cinema League, in 1937 he published one of the first articles on amateur sound, ‘A Talkie Movie Maker Speaks’, in the league’s magazine.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.title: Early abortion
results.brief_description: Uses scenes from a question-and-answer session and from an abortion procedure in order to explain a typical atravmatic abortion procedure. Narrated by Adrienne Barbeau and animation by Robert Greenberg
